newsitem.title: SINGAPORE: Labroy says tanker deals being finalised.
newsitem.headline: Labroy says tanker deals being finalised.

text.p: Newly listed Labroy Marine Ltd said on Monday contracts for the supply of product tankers to Indonesia were still being finalised, and the contracts involved the charter of two tankers.
It was commenting after its share price jumped in the day's trading. "There is speculation on the size of its contracts for the supply of product tankers to Indonesia," one dealer said.
Labroy said in a statement after the market closed that it had "become aware of rumours that the company has secured contracts for product tankers in Indonesia."
It said that as stated in its prospectus earlier in the month, "the contracts are still being finalised."
"The directors wish to further clarify that the contracts involved the charter of two tankers to Pertamina," the statement added. Pertamina is Indonesia's state oil company.
Labroy said further details would be announced when the contracts were finalised and signed.
Labroy finished on Monday at Singapore $0.95, up 12 cents from its close on Friday, when it made its market debut.
Labroy builds commercial tugs, barges, general cargo vessels and marine steel structures and provides ship-repair and conversion services, mainly in its shipyard in Batam, Indonesia.
